abstract.text: An object that lets you manage an Automator workflow in your app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A controller can run and stop a workflow and obtain information about its state. The controller’s delegate (
) receives messages as the workflow is executed and its actions are run.
You can load and run a workflow with minimal overhead by using the
where you need greater control, such as the ability to start and stop the workflow. In that case, you must create and initialize both the workflow and the workflow controller objects.

abstract.text: Develop actions that the Automator app can load and run. View, edit, and run Automator workflows in your app.
An object that lets you use an Automator workflow in your app.
Loads and runs the specified workflow file.
An object that lets you manage an Automator workflow in your app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the controller’s workflow is able to run.
The controller’s delegate.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the controller’s workflow is currently paused.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the controller’s workflow is currently running.
Pauses a workflow that’s running.
Stops a workflow, clears any action results, and resets the workflow back to an un-run state.
Runs the associated workflow, after first clearing any results stored by its actions during any previous run.
In a paused workflow, runs the next action in the workflow and then pauses again.
Stops the associated workflow.
The controller’s workflow.
The controller’s workflow view.
A set of optional methods that a delegate of a workflow controller implements.
An object that lets you view and edit Automator workflows in your app.
A workspace for running an Automator workflow.

An abstract class that implements the [`NSEditor`](doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSEditor) and [`NSEditorRegistration`](doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSEditorRegistration) informal protocols required for controller classes.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A set of methods that controllers can implement to enable an editor view to inform the controller when it has uncommitted changes.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
